items.excerpt:
Hello everyone and welcome back to another Godot community spotlight video. If you are new here, welcome. Each week I try to shine a light on people doing things and explaining how to do things in the Godot engine and hopefully play my small part in growing the Godot community. Recently Godot 4 has been trending upwards on Google Search and looking around YouTube for new and interesting videos has proved to be very fruitful. Here are just a few of the videos I found this week:

Chapters:
00:00 Intro @wojtek_pe 
00:32 @WannibeManisha 
01:05 @martin_senges 
01:49 @sleepycodecat 
02:29 @kat_kuk_ 
03:13 @Boutricks 

Wojtek:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=83VoLaB7ALo&t=160s

Wannabe:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6m0xzrh7ku4&t=1s

Martin:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5zLIWQp_Pts

SleepyCat:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SiuVvskVs-0&t=85s

Kat:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oNVwMXZuiGs&t=226s

Bou:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZXG62XhDql4&t=7s
items.title: Godot 4 is coming home ¬¶ Community Spotlight

items.excerpt:
In this Godot 4 tutorial, you will learn how to create a high quality water shader script from scratch and apply it to a single plane mesh.

I go through basic shader setup, albedo, roughness, and metallic settings, and normal map setup and animation.

I also cover more advanced water shader features like vertex noise displacement, depth color, and edge detection.

You will learn some basics about the Godot shading language and have knowledge you can use to create your own Godot shaders in the Godot Engine.

You can also check out the written tutorial here: https://stayathomedev.com/tutorials/single-plane-water-shader/?utm_source=youtube&utm_medium=description&utm_campaign=tutorials&utm_content=watershader

The tutorial project files are also available to registered users on the StayAtHomeDev website (link below).

Support the Channel!

‚úÖ StayAtHomeDev Website - https://stayathomedev.com/?utm_source=youtube&utm_medium=desc&utm_content=watershader

üéÆ StayAtHomeDev Discord Server - https://discord.gg/dmYbvFYQRQ
üíõ Level Up+ Your Support - http://patreon.com/stayathomedev

More Videos!

‚úÖ My Dream Game Devlog Series
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NXCN7L7RwJE&list=PLEHvj4yeNfeG_rYcHaHNznViZngQfJ0OB

‚úÖ I Built A Game in Godot 4 While Unreal Loaded
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G6OGM4fdF3M

‚úÖ My First Impressions of the Godot Engine
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FY4L9doIILQ

‚úÖ I Ported My Unreal 5 Prototype to Godot 4
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aeOq8DkyGRo

‚úÖ This Week in Godot (more episodes)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QFvczpBbJHo&list=PLEHvj4yeNfeHArSU6U2a715ssJYYCnKCg

Chapters: 

0:00 Start
0:12 Project Setup
1:51 Setting Up the Shader
2:53 Creating Albedo, Roughness, Metallic
4:05 Creating Dual Normal Maps
5:48 Animating Normal Maps in the Shader
6:49 Adding Fresnel Effect to Water Surface
7:57 Adjusting Vertex Height with Noise Map
10:04 Creating Depth Color
11:17 Edge Detection
12:25 Final Results
12:44 Tutorial and Project File Download

Resources:

Godot - https://godotengine.org/
Godot Documentation - https://docs.godotengine.org/en/stable/
Download Godot - https://godotengine.org/download

#godot  #godotengine  #godot4

items.excerpt: This example uses undocumented behaviour of Godot 4's LightmapGI node, which calls get_bake_bmeshes() to fetch meshes on each Node3D (excluding MeshInstance3D). Also I'm using patch which adds texel_scale to LightmapGI node, to shorten the baking time by reducing shadows texture size/quality: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/64908

items.excerpt:
After finishing my last project, I decided for beta 11 (or beta 12 by the time I finished it), I was going to make an archery game based off archery from Wii sports resort. So, after spending the week working on it, this is what I accomplished.

If you would like to play the game, here's the link for it on itch.
Just note that I was only able to test it on Mac, so things may not run as expected on other platforms.
https://jenjell.itch.io/archery
items.title: Archery - Godot 4 Beta 12

How to make a simple online multiplayer FPS game in Godot 4 and play with friends over the internet. Big thank you to @ditzyninja for his Godot 4 networking content!

0:00 Intro

=== Blender Modeling ===
0:34 Environment Model
3:48 Pistol Model

=== Godot 4 Project Setup ===
6:56 Import / Download Assets
8:28 Environment Setup

=== Basic Player Controller ===
9:49 Player Movement
13:46 Create Pistol Animations
16:36 Integrate Pistol Animations
19:32 Muzzle Flash Effect

=== Multiplayer Setup ===
22:13 Host/Join UI
24:52 Server/Client Setup
28:17 MultiplayerSpawner Node
27:22 Set Multiplayer Authority
30:44 MultiplayerSynchronizer Node

=== Remote Procedure Calls ===
31:29 RPC: Play Shoot Effects
32:55 RPC: Receive Damage

=== Misc ===
36:26 Health Bar Setup
39:41 Handling Disconnects

=== Playing Online ===
40:51 UPnP Setup
44:01 Export and Share

45:27 Outro
